title: Mozilla VPN Upgrade Failed
content:
Tried updating to latest version. The msi installer ran quite a ways, removed my previous version, but then stopped with this error: "Service 'Mozilla VPN (broker)' (MozillaVPNBroker) could no be installed. Verify that you have sufficient privileges to install system services."

Now VPN doesn't launch, because the updater removed the existing version. How do I get past this?

Mark P

Ao sincronizar minha conta na nova máquina estranhei não haver opção de reabrir as abas que estavam abertas no outro navegador, mas as abri pelo histórico, no entanto os favoritos sumiram, tentei algumas sugestões que vi aqui no site e no fórum e nada, mas como meu computador pessoal também fica logado com minha conta Firefox achei que poderia recuperar meus favoritos ali.

Ao iniciar o Firefox no meu computador pessoal a barra de favoritos estava normal, mas em um segundo ela desapareceu, ficando apenas a página de Introdução do Firefox como página favorita, alguém tem alguma sugestão de como recuperar os favoritos? Imagino que pelo meu computador pessoal seja mais fácil.

title: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR desde el 22/02/2023
content:
Buenas tardes, desde el miércoles 22/02/2023 Firefox ha dejado de funcionar. Todas las páginas a las que intento acceder muestran: PR_CONNECT_RESET_ERROR. He seguido los consejos leídos, borrado de cookies, restaurar firefox, cambios de DNS, lo que se pueda encontrar por internet lo he estado siguiendo, pero nada, no consigo que vuelva a funcionar. No se ha instalado nada, llevo usando el mismo antivirus desde siempre Kaspersky Internet Security y como digo no se ha instalado nada nuevo en el equipo (que sea consciente, al menos).

¿Alguna idea de por dónde seguir?. Con Chrome no tengo problemas de acceso a las mismas páginas que pruebo en Firefox y como comento, ha sido "de la noche a la mañana", el martes todo iba bien y desde el miércoles imposible acceder a nada.

title: SCARY MIDI access message misleading
content:
A site I went to for the first time popped up a message that implied it wanted to INSTALL something in my browser. I sent a message to the site owners asking why their site was trying to install an add-on in my browser with no warning or notice about what it actually was. I was embarrassed to find this was far from true - it just wanted MIDI access permissions. (See included image.)

This popup is badly worded, misleading, and needs to be changed. MIDI access, unless it's been coded extremely wrong, cannot "steal your data", download anything, or force anything involving malware. And it certainly isn't INSTALLING anything, so why does the button say "Continue to Installation"??? The worst it could do would be to play unwanted notes!

The message needs to include SPECIFICS, as well. Which device(s) is the site requesting permission for would be real good to know. Every other browser includes this information when asking to grant permissions.

Please fix this as soon as possible. And fire the person that decided this pop-up was good enough to be in a working release.
creator: chrisw63

title: Problemi con il sito unieuro.it
content:

Connessione sicura non riuscita

Si è verificato un errore durante la connessione a www.unieuro.it. 

   La pagina che si sta cercando di visualizzare non può essere mostrata in quanto non è possibile verificare l’autenticità dei dati ricevuti.    Contattare il responsabile del sito web per informarlo del problema.

Provando con altri browser tipo Google Chrome o Microsoft Edge, funziona tutto regolarmente.

Come posso risolvere?

title: Descarga certificado digital
content:
Llegado al último paso, Firefox no me descarga un certificado digital de la FNMT (Fáfrica Nacional de Moneda y Timbre), que debía instalarse en el navegador del dispositivo desde el que hacía la gestión (un ordenador), aunque sí había descargado previamente una copia para otro dispositivo.

Notificación que aparece:

Advertencia: riesgo potencial de seguridad a continuación Firefox ha detectado una posible amenaza de seguridad y no ha cargado www.culturaydeporte.gob.es. Si visita este sitio, los atacantes podrían intentar robar información como sus contraseñas, correos electrónicos o detalles de su tarjeta de crédito. ¿Qué puede hacer al respecto? El problema está probablemente en el sitio web, y no hay nada que pueda hacer para resolverlo. Si está en una red corporativa o utilizando un antivirus, puede ponerse en contacto con el equipo de asistencia para obtener ayuda. También puede notificar el problema al administrador del sitio web.
creator: jmhsoto

title: Cannot open links in outlook emails after firefox re-install
content: Yesterday I was forced to update Firefox because of endless pop-ups telling me to. It would not update so, following Firefox support page advice I un-installed it and re-installed it. Now I cannot open any links in Outlook emails. I have changed the default to other browsers and cannot open links in any of them. I get the message "This operation has been cancelled due to restrictions in effect on this computer. Please contact your system administrator". I have found various references to this issue indicating that it is caused by leaving Firefox as default before uninstalling. It would have been helpful to know this first. I have tried all other solutions other than a registry edit which I am understandably nervous of. So now it appears that I have a permanently broken system thanks to Firefox forcing an update which I was happy to live without. I am on Windows 7 and yes, I know it is old and out of support for many things nowadays but the fact is it meets my needs and I had no reason to change. I have reset the default browser and uninstalled Firefox again but it is still broken. I tried a Microsoft fix which, without warning, forced me to upgrade to Microsoft Edge so my system which was just fine yesterday is apparently never going to be the same again. Can anyone tell me how to fix this?

title: 503 error means I can't access Uniprot database
content:
So, I need to use the website Uniprot regularly for my course this semester - a website which acts primarily as a protein database. However, when I try to search for anything using my copy of Firefox, I get a 503 error message as photographed below. I would assume this was a problem with the server, not my copy of Firefox, except that I get the requested results:

  • On other browsers
  • On copies of Firefox on other computers
  • When I go into Private Browing on my copy of Firefox
  • When I hard-refresh the page (Shift + Refresh) on my own regular Firefox

For reference, I have left an image of how the website should look below as well. This is quite annoying as I need to use this for my college work and Firefox is my browser of choice, plus I have noticed similar issues when accessing other databases (E.g.: NCBI). I have tried disabling/deleting all my extensions, refreshing Firefox to default, clearing my cache and cookies, and going so far as to completely uninstall Firefox and delete its files on my computer and re-download it, and nothing seems to be working. I am at my wits end and would appreciate any help anyone can give. Thank you.

This is the website in question: https://www.uniprot.org/
